definition: to draw up the theme (for discussion)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: I didn't know the answers to the teacher's questions so I cribbed them off John.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道教師出題的答案，便抄襲了約翰的。

sentences.english: Daniel, the audience is still waiting for your question.
sentences.chinese: 大牛，觀衆朋友們還等着你出題呢。

sentences.english: But they are still used frequently by test-makers of all types.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們卻仍在被各種出題者所頻繁應用。

sentences.english: The son, grandson of the topic, not Lao Tzu.
sentences.chinese: 孫子出題，兒子監考，老子不會。

sentences.english: Last term our maths teacher set so difficult an examination problem _none of us worked out.
sentences.chinese: 上學期數學老師考試出題太難，沒有一個人能解出來。

sentences.english: Some matters needing attention in design of the examination were also discussed.
sentences.chinese: 文中也討論了客觀考試出題時需要注意的問題。

sentences.english: Our viewers in front the TV are still waiting for your question.
sentences.chinese: 電視機前的觀衆朋友們還等着你出題呢。

definition: to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
to learn on the job/to be on probation
to determine the recipient of an award through discussion
